page.title: 18THE NORTH NORFOLK RAILWAY.
page.content: The Railway came to{Sheringham}in 1887 as part of the old L.N.E.R. line from{Norwich}through{Sheringham}and on to the{Midlands}through{Holt}and {Melton Constable. }The line was closed by Dr.Beeching in the 1960's.The{NORTH {NORFOLK RAILWAY}was formed and is now a working steam line going the three miles from{Sheringham}to{Weybourne.}It is being extended another three miles towards{High Kelling.}It has got one engine that runs and some that are part of a museum. The train runs in the summer months for three days a week on Sunday, Wednesday and Friday. At Christmas there is a Santa Special to{Weybourne.}Children get a present from Santa and the adults get a drink and a mince pie. It is sometimes called the{"Poppy Line"}and is often used in films. To get into the museum you have to pay 10p.
